leitej.util.stream

Class BinaryFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.util.stream.BinaryFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, RandomAccessBinaryItf

    public final class BinaryFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements RandomAccessBinaryItf
    An useful class to help read or write a file stream piece by piece.
    Author:
    Julio Leite

    • Constructor Detail

      • BinaryFile

        public BinaryFile(java.lang.String filename,
                  RandomAccessModeEnum mode)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.lang.SecurityException
        Creates a new instance of FilePieces.
        Parameters:
        filename - the system-dependent filename
        mode - the access mode
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the mode is "read" but the given string does not denote an existing regular file, or if the mode is "read and write" but the given string does not denote an existing, writable regular file and a new regular file of that name cannot be created, or if some other error occurs while opening or creating the file
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or the mode is "rw" and the security manager's checkWrite method denies write access to the file

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read(long fileOff)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Specified by:
        read in interface RandomAccessBinaryItf
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public int read(long fileOff,
                byte[] buff)
         throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: RandomAccessBinaryItf
        Reads up to buff.length bytes of data from this file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.

        Although FilePieces is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[], int, int) method of InputStream.

        Specified by:
        read in interface RandomAccessBinaryItf
        Parameters:
        fileOff - the first byte of the file to be read
        buff - the buffer into which the data is read
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If buff is null
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the random access file has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

      • read

        public int read(long fileOff,
                byte[] buff,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                java.lang.NullPointerException,
                java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: RandomAccessBinaryItf
        Reads up to len bytes of data from this file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.

        Although FilePieces is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[], int, int) method of InputStream.

        Specified by:
        read in interface RandomAccessBinaryItf
        Parameters:
        fileOff - the first byte of the file to be read
        buff - the buffer into which the data is read
        off - the start offset in array b at which the data is written
        len - the maximum number of bytes read
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the file has been reached
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If buff is null
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the random access file has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
